SafetyInspectionBy: PA Department of Labor and Industry-Bureau of Occ

_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: Combustible Gas Indicators (fixed x4), temperature/pressure/flow/level gauges
_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Rail off-load system, 30,000 gal. butane vessel, electric vaporizer

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Buckeye Pipe Line Company L.P. - Macungie Station complies with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) #58 (2004 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas storage, and it is this facility's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws/codes.  If an emergency were to occur, it is the facility's policy to notify the Lehigh County LEPC as well as the Lower Macungie Fire Department and Emergency Management Agency, as necessary.  Medical emergencies will require notification of the Lehigh County LEPC, Macungie Ambulance Corps and Lehigh Valley Hospital.  This facility does not maintain a trained fire brigade but does employ a hazardous materials response team and trained incipient stage fire response on-site to respond to small or the initial stages of an emergency.

The Buckeye Pipe Line Company L.P. - Macungie Station is a pipeline breakout station, including butane blending operations.  The Risk Management Program (RMP) covers the butane blending and propane systems only, including the associated piping and storage vessels, butane and propane railcars (propane storage for an adjacent facility may occur on the Buckeye Pipe Line rail spur), a remote butane, and vaporizer fuel (propane) vessels.

This facility's worst case scenario is the failure of one of the blending system's butane storage vessels when filled to the greatest amount allowed resulting in a vapor cloud explosion.  The resulting distance to the endpoint (1 PSI overpressure) extends off-site and includes public and environmental receptors.  The facility's alternate (most likely) release scenario is a Vapor Cloud Explosion of a butane railcar filled to the greatest amount allowed.  The resulting distance to the endpoint 1 PSI overpressure extends off-site, and includes public and environmental receptors

The Buckeye Pipe Line Company L.P. - Macungie Station complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) accident prevention rules (40 CFR Part 68  Subpart D), th

e Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR Part 1910.119), and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.  This butane blending system is designed, constructed and maintained in accordance with NFPA #58 and the manufacturer's (Mid-Continent Energy and Texon LP) instructions.

To date, this facility has never had an accident involving butane which has resulted in deaths, injuries or property/environmental damage, evacuations or shelterings in-place.

In the event of an emergency involving the Buckeye Pipe Line Company L.P. - Macungie Station's butane blending system, it is the policy of the facility to initially contact the Lehigh County LEPC and the Lower Macungie Fire Department and request their assistance.  The facility currently has no trained fire brigade but does employ a hazardous materials response team and trained incipient fire response group.  The facility emergency response plans are coordinated by the fire department and the Lehigh County LEPC along with the Lower Macungie Emergency Management Agency.  The Lower Macungie Fire Department/Emergency Management Agency/Code Enforcement and Fire Inspector have participated in the initial RMP/PSM training session for this system.

Process safety improvements being considered for this site include more frequent first responder drill participation, further integrating PSM/RMP documentation into the corporate Share Point system.  Also evaluation of other best practices including replace black ESD activators with red units (refer to Compliance Audit for non-regulatory, best practice considerations.)
